articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Russia's foreign minister said in an interview that it was not easy to agree with the United States on the key parts of a possible peace deal to end the war in Ukraine.
articles.title: Russia says it is not easy to agree Ukraine peace deal with U.S.

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The Kremlin said on Tuesday that there is not yet a clear outline of a potential U.S.-Russia deal on Ukraine, but that the political will to move in the direction of an agreement is there.
articles.title: Kremlin says there is no outline yet for US-Russia deal on Ukraine, but political will is there

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: China is "tearing down walls" and expanding its circle of trading partners, "shaking hands" instead of "shaking fists", its foreign ministry said on Tuesday, as Beijing works on diversifying ties amid an escalating trade war with the U.S.
articles.title: China says it is 'tearing down walls' to expand trade alliances amid US standoff

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei said on Tuesday he was neither "overly optimistic nor pessimistic" about talks with the U.S. on Iran's nuclear programme, in an apparent move by Tehran to play down growing public expectations of a deal.
articles.title: Iran's Khamenei neither 'overly optimistic nor pessimistic' about US nuclear talks

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Andrew Tate, an internet personality and self-described misogynist, faces a 2027 trial in four women's civil lawsuits for alleged physical and sexual abuse, in a case their lawyers say is the first of its kind in Britain about allegations of coercive control.
articles.title: Andrew Tate faces UK civil trial in 2027 over abuse, coercive control allegations

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The investigation into the deaths of British tech tycoon Mike Lynch, banker Jonathan Bloomer and members of their families who perished when a luxury yacht sank last year will take many months, a British inquest was told on Tuesday.
articles.title: Inquest into death of tech tycoon Mike Lynch in yacht sinking will take 'many months', court hears

articles.author: Nelson Renteria, Sarah Kinosian
articles.description: Lawyers challenging the incarceration in El Salvador of more than 200 Venezuelans deported by the U.S. said the Salvadoran government is denying the prisoners access to attorneys and contact with the outside world.
articles.title: Lawyers say El Salvador blocks access to detained Venezuelans

articles.author: Joshua McElwee
articles.description: Carlo Acutis, a British-born Italian boy who built websites to spread his faith, will be proclaimed the Catholic Church's first saint of the millennial generation this month, elevating him to the same level as Mother Teresa and Francis of Assisi.
articles.title: Italian teen set to be first millennial saint was 'ordinary child', says mother

articles.author: Olivia Le Poidevin
articles.description: United Nations Secretary-General Antonio Guterres is "deeply alarmed" at Sunday's strike by Israeli forces on the Al-Ahli Arab Hospital in Gaza, his spokesperson said on Tuesday.
articles.title: UN chief 'deeply alarmed' by Israeli strike on Al-Ahli hospital in Gaza
Armenia calls on Azerbaijan to investigate ceasefire violations on border
